messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Asteroids are big rocks that fly in space. Some asteroids can be dangerous. They are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' (PHAs). This is when they fly very near to Earth. NASA made a map of 1,400 PHAs. But none of them are a danger for the next 100 years. NASA has technology now to follow these rocks. It can know if they are going to hit Earth. If an asteroid is a danger, NASA has two plans to protect us.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The word 'protect' is B1 level. It is not an acceptable A2 replacement for the B1 word 'defence'. The output also omits the key factual detail of '7.5 million kilometres', replacing it with the imprecise phrase 'very near to Earth'. This is a factual omission. The rules are absolute.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Asteroids are big rocks that fly in space. Some asteroids can be dangerous. They are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' (PHAs). This is when they fly less than 7.5 million kilometres from Earth. NASA made a map of 1,400 PHAs. But none of them are a danger for the next 100 years. NASA has technology now to follow these rocks. It can know if they are going to hit Earth. If an asteroid is a danger, NASA has two plans to keep us safe.

metadata.feedback_text: The provided JSON is a flawless example of the required evaluation format. The feedback is direct, blunt, and concise, justifying the grade by citing specific examples like the replacement of 'potentially' and 'threat'. The structure and content are perfect.
